meanings.definition: A point at which something ends or terminates.
meanings.sent1: The endpoints of the race were marked with colorful flags.
meanings.sent2: The road's endpoints were clearly visible in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the toy mouse was the endpoint of its hunt.
meanings.sent4: The old tree served as the endpoint of the forest trail.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map led to a mysterious endpoint deep in the jungle.

meanings.definition: The points at which a line or curve ends.
meanings.sent1: She carefully plotted the endpoints of the graph on the chart.
meanings.sent2: The artist focused on highlighting the endpoints of the brush strokes.
meanings.sent3: The cake decorator added colorful sprinkles at the endpoints of the design.
meanings.sent4: The rainbow seemed to touch the endpoints of the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The endpoints of the rainbow shimmered in the sunlight.
